path_1.title: Patriot Games (1992)
path_1.feeling: Lean, personal-stakes spy thriller that lands squarely in my comfort zone

path_1.title: O Brother, Where Art Thou? (2000)
path_1.feeling: Quirky, clever caper with charm—fun ride if not quite a favorite

path_1.title: Dumbo (1941)
path_1.feeling: Sweet and simple, though the old-fashioned sentiment only goes so far for me

path_1.title: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York (1992)
path_1.feeling: Some laughs, but the recycled gags wear thin

path_1.title: Fools Rush In (1997)
path_1.feeling: Pleasant enough, but formula romance and culture-clash beats feel lightweight

path_1.title: Harvard Man (2001)
path_1.feeling: Ambitious but messy, with ideas that don’t quite cohere

path_1.title: Startup.com (2001)
path_1.feeling: Compelling rise-and-fall doc that scratches my business-drama itch

path_1.title: Unfaithful (2002)
path_1.feeling: Tense and moody, though the infidelity melodrama keeps me at arm’s length

path_1.title: Dracula (Bram Stoker's Dracula) (1992)
path_1.feeling: Lush and gothic, but the romance/horror blend isn’t really my thing

path_1.title: Hollow Man (2000)
path_1.feeling: High-concept effects can’t cover thin characters and nasty turns

path_1.title: Rear Window (1954)
path_1.feeling: Masterclass in suspense—exactly the kind of gripping mystery I love

path_1.title: Enigma (2001)
path_1.feeling: Solid wartime codebreaker intrigue with just enough romance

path_1.title: 2010: The Year We Make Contact (1984)
path_1.feeling: Talky, cool-headed space drama I respect more than enjoy

path_1.title: Gift, The (2000)
path_1.feeling: Moody small-town mystery with enough tension to keep me engaged

path_1.title: Wyatt Earp (1994)
path_1.feeling: Handsome but bloated—I prefer my westerns leaner

path_1.title: Spider-Man (2002)
path_1.feeling: Earnest and lively, though the superhero gloss keeps me a bit detached

path_1.title: Lost World: Jurassic Park, The (1997)
path_1.feeling: Spectacle over smarts—entertaining in spurts but forgettable

path_1.title: Zero Effect (1998)
path_1.feeling: Quirky, clever detective story that hits my sweet spot

path_1.title: We Were Soldiers (2002)
path_1.feeling: Sturdy war drama that feels heavy-handed and conventional

path_1.title: Bambi (1942)
path_1.feeling: Classic and gentle, if a bit saccharine for my taste

path_1.title: Event Horizon (1997)
path_1.feeling: Grim sci-fi horror that’s not my cup of tea

path_1.title: Minority Report (2002)
path_1.feeling: Smart, propulsive sci-fi noir that works despite my genre hesitance

path_1.title: Sleepless in Seattle (1993)
path_1.feeling: Warm and charming, even if I’m not a full-on romantic

path_1.title: Hollow Man (2000)
path_1.feeling: Slick but mean-spirited thriller that leaves me cold

path_1.title: Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, The (2001)
path_1.feeling: Epic and earnest, but high fantasy leaves me a bit cold

path_1.title: Face/Off (1997)
path_1.feeling: Stylish, high-concept cat-and-mouse that I can’t resist

path_1.title: Gattaca (1997)
path_1.feeling: Elegant, idea-driven sci-fi that plays to my tastes

path_1.title: Psycho (1998)
path_1.feeling: Classic setup still works well enough to keep me invested

path_1.title: Days of Thunder (1990)
path_1.feeling: Glossy racing melodrama that revs more than it grips

path_1.title: Disclosure (1994)
path_1.feeling: Slick 90s thriller vibes I enjoy, even if it’s a bit pulpy

path_5.title: Hollow Man (2000)
path_5.feeling: Same sleek setup, same nasty descent—effective moments but not for me.

path_5.title: Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, The (2001)
path_5.feeling: Epic world-building I respect more than I emotionally connect with.

path_5.title: Face/Off (1997)
path_5.feeling: Stylish, over-the-top action ride that’s fun yet silly in equal measure.

path_5.title: Gattaca (1997)
path_5.feeling: Elegant, thoughtful sci‑fi that hits my sweet spot for character and theme.

path_5.title: Psycho (1998)
path_5.feeling: Point-for-point remake that feels redundant and lifeless.

path_5.title: Days of Thunder (1990)
path_5.feeling: Slick, formula racing melodrama that goes down easy and fades fast.

path_5.title: Disclosure (1994)
path_5.feeling: Glossy 90s corporate thriller that’s engaging if dated and pulpy.

path_5.title: Patriot Games (1992)
path_5.feeling: Tense, competent Clancy thriller with family-in-peril stakes that keep me engaged.

path_5.title: O Brother, Where Art Thou? (2000)
path_5.feeling: Charming, rambling caper with enough wit and music to win me over.

path_5.title: Dumbo (1941)
path_5.feeling: Sweet, simple classic that moves in spots but feels slight to me.

path_5.title: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York (1992)
path_5.feeling: Familiar slapstick rerun that amuses in bits but wears thin.

path_5.title: Fools Rush In (1997)
path_5.feeling: Culture-clash romcom that’s cute but pretty formulaic.

path_5.title: Harvard Man (2001)
path_5.feeling: Glossy, try-hard campus drama whose pretensions outweigh its insights.

path_5.title: Startup.com (2001)
path_5.feeling: Engaging rise-and-fall doc where the friendship stakes hooked me more than the business.

path_5.title: Unfaithful (2002)
path_5.feeling: Adult temptation thriller that’s compelling if a bit overheated.

path_5.title: Dracula (Bram Stoker's Dracula) (1992)
path_5.feeling: Lush gothic romance whose operatic excess keeps me at arm’s length.

path_5.title: Hollow Man (2000)
path_5.feeling: Slick sci-fi premise devolves into mean-spirited thrills that don’t do much for me.

path_5.title: Rear Window (1954)
path_5.feeling: Masterfully taut voyeuristic mystery that hits my suspense sweet spot.

path_5.title: Enigma (2001)
path_5.feeling: Solid wartime codebreaker intrigue with a human pulse I appreciated.

path_5.title: 2010: The Year We Make Contact (1984)
path_5.feeling: Thoughtful, measured sci-fi I respect more than I get excited by.

path_5.title: Gift, The (2000)
path_5.feeling: Moody small-town mystery with enough atmosphere and character to pull me in.

path_5.title: Wyatt Earp (1994)
path_5.feeling: Handsome but ponderous western that left me cold.

path_5.title: Spider-Man (2002)
path_5.feeling: Earnest, entertaining origin tale that delivers crowd-pleasing energy.

path_5.title: Lost World: Jurassic Park, The (1997)
path_5.feeling: Big, noisy dino spectacle that’s fun in spurts but largely clunky.

path_5.title: Zero Effect (1998)
path_5.feeling: Offbeat detective yarn whose quirky character work and puzzles I enjoyed.

path_5.title: We Were Soldiers (2002)
path_5.feeling: Sobering combat drama that’s respectable if conventional.

path_5.title: Bambi (1942)
path_5.feeling: Gentle, beautifully animated coming-of-age that I admire more than adore.

path_5.title: Event Horizon (1997)
path_5.feeling: Grimy sci-fi horror with nasty streaks that turn me off.

path_5.title: Minority Report (2002)
path_5.feeling: Propulsive, idea-driven thriller that scratches my mystery itch.

path_5.feeling: Soft-hearted romance that’s sweet if a tad too saccharine for me.

path_5.title: Hollow Man (2000)
path_5.feeling: Same slick setup, same empty, abrasive payoff for me.

path_5.feeling: Grand, well-crafted fantasy I respect more than I connect with.

path_5.feeling: High-concept action with style to spare but only sporadically gripping for me.
